summary: The 1960s was the decade that started on January 1, 1960 and ended on December 31, 1969. Many things happened in the sixties, including the Space Race, the Civil Rights movement and the Vietnam War.
full_text:
The 1960s was a decade that began on January 1, 1960 and ended on December 31, 1969.
The term "1960s" also refers to an era more often called the Sixties, denoting the complex of inter-related cultural and political trends around the globe. This "cultural decade" is more loosely defined than the actual decade, beginning around 1963 and ending around 1974.
^ Joshua Zeitz "1964: The Year the Sixties Began", American Heritage, Oct. 2006.
^ John Barth  intro to The Literature of Exhaustion, in The Friday Book.
^ Maslin, Janet . "Brokaw Explores Another Turning Point, the '60s". The New York Times. Retrieved 26 August 2011.
title: 1960s
